topic: How to optimize notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to optimize notebooks to production using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Optimizing Jupyter Notebooks for Production using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide explains how to convert a Jupyter Notebook into a production-ready API using FastAPI, an modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: Understand the limitations of Jupyter Notebooks in a production environment
Convert notebook cells to modular Python scripts
Utilize FastAPI to build a web API from those scripts
Leverage Type Hints, Async/Await and other features offered by Python 3.12+ for efficiency
Test and debug the API effectively

code_examples.code:
async def get_data(some_func):
    # Some asynchronous function implementation here

version_notes: Python 3.12+ is required for the usage of Type Hints, Async/Await and other features that improve performance.
FastAPI version 0.76.0 or later is recommended.
caveats: The conversion process can be time-consuming and may require adjustments to account for differences between notebooks and standalone scripts
Testing and debugging can become more challenging in a production environment
